str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From schole; to take a holiday, i.e. Be at leisure for; figuratively, to be vacant.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To sweep, cleanse by sweeping. From a derivative of sairo; meaning a broom; to sweep.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To put into order; I decorate, deck, adorn. From kosmos; to put in proper order, i.e. Decorate; specially, to snuff.
